posts.post_content:
Posted By: Joe D.
In an effort to raise funds -
I am parting with one of my favorites.

1860s Baseball Stereoview of a game in action in front of crowd/building.  
The view is toward home plate and you can see a batter as he readies for the pitch.



*now on eBay
First come, first served.




[IMG]http://www.internetville.com/stuff/1860bball.jpg[/IMG]


[IMG]http://www.internetville.com/stuff/1860baseball.jpg[/IMG]

Posted By: Joe D.
Will consider and respond to any offer sent my way.

Great 1860s stereoview of the game of baseball being played (game action). 


Send any offer for purchase or trade.


Current wantlist:
T200s, e101 cobby, e101 wagner.


joe@internetville.com


Thanks,
Joe

Posted By: Jay
That picture gave me the chills. Think any of those bystanders got hit with a foul ball?

Posted By: Joe D.
Jay,

Don't worry - there were no foul balls that day.

Although Cy Young's more talented cousin was the pitcher, Ty Cobb's more talented cousin was the batter,  Shoeless Joe's more talented cousin was on-deck.
No foul balls... just lots of hits.  [IMG]https://www.net54baseball.com/images/happy.gif[/IMG]

Thanks for the bump btw... still on eBay with just a few days to go... someone make me an offer [IMG]https://www.net54baseball.com/images/happy.gif[/IMG]
